In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia. This function iterates over the words in the input string and adds a newline character when the next word would exceed the specified `text_width`.

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
str = "This is an example of a long string that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str, text_width=20)
println(wrapped_str)
```

This will output:

```
This is an
example of a
long string
that needs to
be wrapped.
```
